de.tud.kom.p2psim.api.common
Interface Monitor

All Superinterfaces:
Configurable, SimulationEventHandler
All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultMonitor
public interface Monitor
extends Configurable, SimulationEventHandler

Monitor defines a central instance which is called by components whenever an action occurs that is important to trace. In particular, upon calling a specific monitor method, the monitor delegates notifications to all installed analyzers.

Version:
3.0, 12/03/2007
Author:
Sebastian Kaune, Konstantin Pussep

Nested Class Summary
static class Monitor.Reason
          Provides additional information why an action occurs at a specific component

Method Detail

setStart

void setStart(long time)
Sets the point in time at which the simulation framework will activate the monitoring of actions

Parameters:
time - time at which the monitoring starts

setStop

void setStop(long time)
Sets the point in time at which the simulation framework will deactivate the monitoring of actions

Parameters:
time - time at which the monitoring ends

netMsgEvent

void netMsgEvent(NetMessage msg,
                 NetID id,
                 Monitor.Reason reason)
Invoking this method denotes that an action related to a network message is occured on the network layer with the given NetID. The reason why this action is occured is specified by the given reason such as send, receive or drop.

Parameters:
msg - the related network message
id - the NetId of the network layer of the occuring event
reason - the reason why this event happened

operationInitiated

void operationInitiated(Operation<?> op)
This method is called whenever an operation has been triggered.

Parameters:
op - the Operation that has been triggered.

operationFinished

void operationFinished(Operation<?> op)
Invoking this method denotes that an operation is finished

Parameters:
op - the finished operation

transMsgSent

void transMsgSent(AbstractTransMessage msg)
Invoking this method denotes that the given message is sent at the transport layer (from the application towards the network layer).

Parameters:
msg - the AbstractTransMessage which is sent out.

transMsgReceived

void transMsgReceived(AbstractTransMessage msg)
Invoking this method denotes that the given message is received at the transport layer (from the network layer towards the application layer).

Parameters:
msg - the received AbstractTransMessage.

setAnalyzer

void setAnalyzer(Analyzer analyzer)
Registers an analyzer to the monitor which will be notificated about specific actions

Parameters:
analyzer - the given analyzer

churnEvent

void churnEvent(Host host,
                Monitor.Reason reason)
Invoking this method denotes that the physical network connectivity of the given host has been changed cause by churn.

Parameters:
host - the churn affected host
reason - the given reason
